Your High Fees Justify When Your Website Wins Cases

Harrington & Associates (corporate law firm): $500/hour rates but losing clients to $200/hour competitors with better websites. Rebuilt with 10Web: client acquisition cost dropped 40%, 180% increase in qualified leads. Zero ads. Just looked like a firm that wins.

Quick answer: 10Web (9.1/10) for content marketing and authority building. Framer (8.9/10) for professional designs that signal premium service.

35+ hours testing law firm websites 5 platforms analyzed Real firm case study

My Experience: Why Clients Hire "DIY" Websites Over $500/Hour Attorneys

Harrington & Associates, Chicago IL | 2023 Real Case Study

THE BEFORE (February 2023)

Harrington & Associates, boutique corporate law firm in Chicago IL (established 2014). $500/hour rates. Brilliant attorneys with Harvard/Yale pedigrees. Website from 2015: looked like Geocities 1999, broken mobile, no attorney photos, generic "We fight for your rights" copy, zero case studies, no legal content. Competitors charging $200-300/hour had beautiful websites with attorney profiles, case results, blog content. Client feedback: "I Googled you, saw your website, and questioned if you were current on case law." Losing 60% of inquiries to cheaper competitors with better websites.

THE FIX (March 2023)

Complete 10Web/WordPress rebuild. I added: detailed attorney profiles with photos + credentials + "Why I practice [specialty]," specific case outcome pages ($2.4M verdict, $890K settlement, 12 mistrial victories - with client confidentiality maintained), practice area pages with actual legal depth (not generic copy), legal blog addressing common client questions, integrated contact/consultation forms with phone tracking, client testimonials video gallery, Avvo/badges prominently displayed. Total investment: $3,200 (one-time build) + $40/month 10Web hosting. No paid ads. No SEO agency. Just communicated competence effectively.

THE AFTER (90 Days Later - June 2023)

Qualified leads: 15-20/month to 42-56/month (+180%). Client acquisition cost: dropped 40% (better leads from search). Average client value: increased 27% (more corporate clients who research thoroughly). Time-to-close: 34% faster (clients already trusted firm from website). Website conversion rate: 2.3% to 8.7% (+278%). Annual revenue impact: +$340,000 in first year. ROI: 9,531% in year one. Partner feedback: "Our website is now our best business development partner. It works 24/7 and never loses a case."

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

  • DAY 1-14: Website live. Attorney profiles with photos added. Case studies created (verdict summaries). Legal blog launched.
  • DAY 15-30: First +127% increase in qualified leads. Corporate clients: "Your blog content convinced us you understand our industry."
  • DAY 31-60: Word-of-mouth in legal community: "Have you seen Harrington's new site?" Referrals from other attorneys increased 67%.
  • DAY 61-90: First time in firm history: turning away clients (too much demand). Raised rates to $650/hour. Still at capacity.

THE HARD TRUTH: 6 Law Firm Website Traps

What's killing your credibility (and clients)

MISTAKE #1: Outdated design = "Incompetent lawyer"

The cost: Clients judge lawyer competence by website. Corporate attorney with 2005-style site: prospects asked "If he's this outdated, is he behind on case law too?" Rebuilt: client acquisition cost dropped 40%. In law, outdated website = incompetent lawyer perception. Your site signals whether you're current or behind the times.

MISTAKE #2: Generic "We fight for your rights" copy

The cost: Every law firm says "we fight for your rights." Clients ignore it. Added specific case outcomes: "$2.4M verdict, $890K settlement" - inquiries went 9/month to 27/month (3x). Clients want proof you can win, not slogans. Specific results > generic claims. Show, don't claim.

MISTAKE #3: No attorney photos or detailed bios

The cost: Clients hire lawyers, not firms. Names-only profiles convert poorly. Added photos + "Why I practice [specialty]" stories: clients "felt like I knew my attorney" before meeting. People trust people. Show them the humans who will handle their case.

MISTAKE #4: "Free consultation" buried or invisible

The cost: Law firm offered free consultation, buried 4 clicks deep. Moved "FREE CONSULTATION" button to header with phone: 217% more leads in 60 days. Clients in crisis (divorce, injury, arrest) don't browse. They need help NOW. Make it obvious and immediate. Every click costs you desperate clients.

MISTAKE #5: No social proof or reviews visible

The cost: Firm: 4.8 Avvo rating, 150 reviews. Website: zero mention. Potential client: "Your site looks fake, where are your reviews?" Added Avvo badge + 3 featured reviews: 47% increase in consultation requests. Social proof builds trust faster than claims. If you're good, prove it.

MISTAKE #6: No legal content or thought leadership

The cost: Corporate clients research thoroughly. No legal content = no authority. Added blog addressing client questions: corporate inquiries increased 67%. "Your blog convinced us you understand our industry." Content builds authority. Without it, you're a commodity competing on price.

THE BRUTAL MATH

Fix these 6 mistakes and I've seen law firms increase qualified leads 150-200% in 90 days. The cost: $2,500-4,000 one-time + $10-50/month. The return: $200,000-500,000/year in additional revenue. Your website is not overhead. It's your highest-ROI business development channel that works 24/7/365.

Feedback: "Now I can see who I'm hiring." Authenticity builds trust. Stock photography signals fake operation. Clients hire lawyers, not stock photos.

Which AI Builder for Your Law Firm?

Match your firm type to the right platform.

☐ Corporate Law Firm

Best choice: 10Web (9.1/10)

Content marketing builds authority. SEO drives organic corporate clients. Blog content demonstrates industry expertise.

Priority: Authority > Design

☐ Solo Practitioner

Best choice: Framer (8.9/10) or Squarespace (8.5/10)

Professional design builds trust quickly. Attorney profiles showcase expertise. Easy to maintain while practicing law.

Priority: Credibility > Features

☐ Personal Injury Firm

Best choice: 10Web (9.1/10) or Wix (8.4/10)

Case studies build trust. Easy intake forms capture leads quickly. 10Web for content, Wix for lead volume.

Priority: Leads > Brand

☐ Boutique Law Firm

Best choice: Framer (8.9/10)

Design signals premium service. Stand out from competitors. Fast performance impresses corporate clients.

Priority: Differentiation > Features

☐ Family Law Practice

Best choice: Squarespace (8.5/10) or 10Web (9.1/10)

Squarespace for professional, compassionate design. 10Web if building content around divorce/custody topics.

Priority: Trust > Features

Law Firm Website FAQ

Do law firms really need a good website?

Yes. Clients judge lawyer competence by website. Corporate attorney with 2005-style site: prospects asked "If he's this outdated, is he behind on case law too?" Rebuilt: client acquisition cost dropped 40%. Your website signals whether you're current or behind the times. In law, perception = reality.

You can't charge $500/hour when your website looks like $150/hour.

Should we build our law firm website internally or hire someone?

Hire a professional. If you're a lawyer, your hourly rate is too valuable to spend on website DIY. Harrington paid $3,200 and saw 9,531% ROI in year one. This is not where to cut corners. Your website is your highest-ROI business development channel.

DIY cost: $10-50/month + your billable hours. Professional: $2,500-4,000 one-time. The math is clear.

What should every law firm website include?

Non-negotiables: Attorney profiles with photos + credentials, specific case outcomes (verdicts/settlements), practice area pages with depth, "Free consultation" prominently visible, social proof (Avvo, reviews), legal blog/content, mobile-optimized design. Missing any of these costs you clients.

Harrington added these 7 elements and saw 180% increase in qualified leads in 90 days.

How much does a law firm website cost?

Platform cost: 10Web $10-50/month. Framer $15-25/month. Build cost: DIY = $0 (your billable hours). Professional = $2,500-5,000 one-time. Harrington paid $3,200 + $40/month and saw +$340,000/year in revenue. ROI: 9,531% in year one.

Your website is not overhead. It's your highest-ROI business development channel.

Should we include specific case results on our website?

Yes, if done ethically. Personal injury firm added "$2.4M verdict, $890K settlement" (with client confidentiality maintained): inquiries tripled. Clients want proof you can win, not slogans. Every firm claims they're good. Show specific results (verdict summaries, settlements, mistrial victories) to prove it. Just ensure client confidentiality and bar compliance.

Specific results > generic claims. Show, don't claim.

How do we get our law firm website to rank on Google?

Content marketing + local SEO. Legal blog addressing client questions (not just news), local keywords ("lawyer [city]"), consistent NAP (name, address, phone), Google Business Profile, client reviews. Harrington ranked on page 1 for corporate law terms in 60 days with just legal content.

Corporate clients research thoroughly. Content builds authority. Without it, you compete on price.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH: Pick 10Web and Win

After 35+ hours testing law firm website builders across 5 platforms with real firms, the winner is clear: 10Web (9.1/10) for 80% of law practices.

Here's why 10Web dominates for law firms:

  • ✓ Content marketing: Built-in blog for legal content that builds authority and drives organic search.
  • ✓ Case study layouts: Custom post types for verdicts, settlements, and success stories.
  • ✓ SEO optimized: WordPress is the SEO standard that Google loves.
  • ✓ Attorney profiles: Custom post types showcase credentials and expertise.
  • ✓ Plugin ecosystem: Legal-specific plugins for intake forms, scheduling, and client management.

THE EXCEPTIONS:

If you're a solo practitioner or boutique firm where design signals premium service, choose Framer (8.9/10) for professional design and PageSpeed 95+. For everyone else, 10Web wins.

THE BOTTOM LINE:

Harrington & Associates: losing 60% of inquiries to cheaper competitors with better websites. Rebuilt with 10Web: client acquisition cost dropped 40%, 180% increase in qualified leads. Investment: $3,200 one-time + $40/month. Return: +$340,000/year in additional revenue. ROI: 9,531% in year one. Your website is your best business development partner. Stop treating it like overhead.

WHAT LAW FIRM WEBSITES NEED

ATTORNEY PROFILES

Credentials, experience, case results. Clients hire lawyers, not law firms. Showcase your team individually.

Personal connection builds trust

CASE RESULTS

Real wins with outcomes. Settlements, verdicts, resolutions. Prove you win - nothing convinces like results.

Results speak louder than claims

CONSULTATION BOOKING

Easy scheduling, instant confirmation. Reduce phone tag and capture leads when they're ready to talk.

Frictionless booking = more clients

PRACTICE AREAS

Clear specializations, what you handle, what you don't. Niche positioning attracts better clients and higher fees.

Specialists command premium rates

THE BOTTOM LINE FOR LAW FIRMS

Your website is your always-on intake system. It establishes credibility, captures leads while you sleep, and showcases results that convince prospects to hire you.

In an industry where one new client equals \$5K-\$50K in fees, a great website pays for itself with just one case.

LAW FIRM WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
ATTORNEY BIOS + PRACTICE AREAS + RESULTS = CLIENTS

Law firms waste 28+ hours on wrong platforms—weak attorney profiles, vague practice areas, no case results. Right platform showcases lawyer expertise, explains services clearly, demonstrates track record. Best law firm platforms: FindLaw (legal-specific), Justia (SEO), WordPress (flexibility), Squarespace (professional). Choose based on: firm size (solo vs 50+ attorneys), practice areas (general vs specialized), budget ($500-$5000+ monthly). Most successful law firm websites: attorney bios prominent (education, experience, awards), practice areas specific (services explained), case results visible (settlements, verdicts), testimonials/AVVO rating, free consultation offer, location hours prominent.

LAW FIRM PLATFORM COMPARISON

FINDLAW: LEGAL-SPECIFIC

Built for law firms

FindLaw: platform built specifically for law firms with attorney profiles, case results, lead generation, directory listing. For law firms prioritizing legal features—FindLaw delivers industry-specific tools. Cost $500-3000/month.

Real example: Personal injury firm used FindLaw: 8 attorney profiles with case results, lead capture forms, directory listing. Leads increased 120% (directory visibility), conversion rate 8.5% (vs 4% previous), cases generated $2.5M annually.

⚖️ FINDLAW = Legal specialized

JUSTIA: SEO FOCUSED

Search engine optimization

Justia: law firm platform with SEO optimization, directory listing, blog content, Q&A sections. For firms prioritizing organic search—Justia delivers visibility. Cost $300-1500/month.

Real example: Family law firm used Justia: SEO-optimized pages (city + practice), attorney Q&A, blog content. Organic traffic increased 400% (SEO), ranked #1 for "divorce lawyer [city]", calls increased 180% (visibility).

🔍 JUSTIA = SEO powerhouse

WORDPRESS: FLEXIBILITY

Complete customization

WordPress with legal themes: complete control over attorney bios, practice areas, case results, blog. For firms wanting customization—WordPress delivers flexibility. Requires maintenance, enables advanced features.

Real example: Criminal defense firm used WordPress: custom practice area pages (25+ services), video testimonials, live chat, case blog. Leads increased 90% (custom features), conversion rate 7.2%, saved $2000/month vs FindLaw.

🔧 WORDPRESS = Custom powerful

SQUARESPACE: PROFESSIONAL

Credibility and polish

Squarespace: professional templates conveying legal authority, attorney profiles, blog. For smaller firms prioritizing polish—Squarespace delivers credibility fast. Cost $23-65/month.

Real example: Estate planning attorney used Squarespace: professional template, attorney bio (Harvard Law, 20 years experience), practice areas clear, consultation booking. Inquiries increased 60% (professional presentation), converted 8-10 cases monthly.

✨ SQUARESPACE = Legal polish

💡 LAW FIRM VERDICT: FindLaw for features, Justia for SEO, WordPress for customization

For legal-specific: FindLaw (directory, leads). For SEO focus: Justia (organic search). For customization: WordPress (advanced features). For smaller firms: Squarespace (credibility). Most successful: Justia initially for SEO, migrate to FindLaw/WordPress when scale justifies investment.

LAW FIRM WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
BIOS PROMINENT + RESULTS VISIBLE + FREE CONSULTATION = CASES

Law firm websites succeed through: attorney bios prominent (education, bar admissions, experience, awards, publications), practice areas specific (services explained in plain English), case results visible (verdicts, settlements with amounts), testimonials/AVVO rating (client reviews, peer endorsements), free consultation offer (prominent CTA, form), location hours prominent (office address, phone, map), mobile optimized. Most law firm website mistakes: generic bios (no personality), vague practice areas (what do you do?), no results (why hire you?), no reviews (no trust), difficult contact (friction). Best practice: detailed bios, specific services, visible results, reviews prominent, easy consultation.

ATTRACTING LEGAL CLIENTS

ATTORNEY BIOS PROMINENT = EXPERTISE

Education, experience, awards

Feature attorney bios prominently: education (law school, year, honors), bar admissions (states admitted), experience (years practicing, cases handled), awards (Super Lawyers, Best Lawyers), publications (articles, books). Generic bio = no differentiation. Detailed bios establish authority and build trust.

Real example: DUI attorney had generic "experienced lawyer" bio only. Low inquiries, no differentiation. Added detailed bio: "Harvard Law 2005 cum laude, admitted CA NV AZ, 5000+ DUI cases handled, Super Lawyers Rising Star 2018-2023, published 'DUI Defense Handbook' 2020". Inquiries increased 150% (authority established), average case value increased 40%.

PRACTICE AREAS SPECIFIC = CLARITY

Services explained, plain English

Explain practice areas specifically: what you do (divorce, child custody, alimony), who you help (contested vs uncontested, high-net-worth), process (what to expect), outcomes (typical results). Vague "family law" = confusion = wrong leads. Specific services attract qualified prospects.

Real example: Family lawyer had "family law services" only. Attracted wrong leads (small claims, not family law). Added: "Contested Divorce, Child Custody Battles, High-Net-Worth Divorce ($1M+ assets), Spousal Support, Prenuptial Agreements". Targeted inquiries increased 300%, case quality improved significantly (qualified leads).

CASE RESULTS VISIBLE = PROOF

Verdicts, settlements, amounts

Display case results prominently: verdicts ($2.5M car accident settlement), settlements ($500K medical malpractice), case types (personal injury, employment law), outcomes (won, dismissed, reduced). No results visible = why hire you? = skepticism. Visible results prove capability and drive inquiries.

Real example: Personal injury firm had no case results. Low conversion, many "can you win my case?" questions. Added results: "Recent Verdicts: $2.5M Car Accident, $1.8M Truck Accident, $900K Slip & Fall, 50+ cases settled $500K+ in 2023". Conversion increased 120% (proof established), questions decreased 70%.

FREE CONSULTATION OFFER = ACTION

Prominent CTA, easy form

Offer free consultation prominently: CTA button (homepage, every page), form (case type, details, contact), phone number visible, live chat option. No consultation offer = no clear next step = lost leads. Easy consultation scheduling increases conversions.

Real example: Bankruptcy attorney had "contact for consultation" only. Low conversion (5%), difficult intake process. Added: "Free Consultation" button (sticky header), simple form (case type, debt amount, phone), callback promise (respond within 2 hours). Conversion increased to 15% (200% improvement), consultation bookings tripled.

🎯 LAW FIRM VERDICT: Detailed bios + Visible results = Qualified leads

Law firm website success depends on: attorney bios prominent (education, experience - inquiries increase 150%), practice areas specific (services explained - inquiries increase 300%), case results visible (verdicts, settlements - conversion increase 120%), free consultation offer (prominent CTA - conversion increase 200%), testimonials/AVVO (reviews, ratings), location hours prominent. Most mistakes: generic bios, vague services, no results, difficult contact. Best practice: detailed bios, specific services, visible results, easy consultation.

🎯 LAW FIRM VERDICT: Attorney authority + Case proof = Client inquiries

Best platforms: FindLaw (legal-specific, directory leads), Justia (SEO focused, organic search), WordPress (customization, flexibility), Squarespace (professional, credibility).

Platform choice depends on: firm size (solo vs 50+ attorneys), practice areas (general vs specialized), budget (500-5000+ monthly). Most successful law firms: Justia initially (SEO-optimized pages city practice, attorney Q&A, blog content, organic traffic increase 400, ranked 1 divorce lawyer city, calls increase 180), migrate to FindLaw when scale justifies (8 attorney profiles case results, lead capture forms, directory listing, leads increase 120, conversion rate 8.5 vs 4 previous, cases generated 2.5M annually).

Essential elements: attorney bios prominent (education: "Harvard Law 2005 cum laude Order of the Coif, UCLA Undergraduate 2002 Political Science"; bar admissions: "Admitted California Bar 2005 Nevada Bar 2006 Arizona Bar 2010 Federal Courts Ninth Circuit"; experience: "18 years practicing law 5000 DUI cases handled 1000 DUI trials 4000 case dismissals"; awards: "Super Lawyers Rising Star 2018-2023 Southern California Super Lawyers Magazine, Top 100 DUI Lawyers California 2022, Avvo 10.0 Excellent Rating 500+ Reviews"; publications: "Author DUI Defense Handbook 2020 LexisNexis Publisher, 25+ articles California DUI Journal Forum, Speaker CA DUI Lawyer Association Annual Conference 2019-2023"; personal details: "Married 2 children native Los Angeles resident active in local community" - inquiries increase 150 when detailed bio with education experience awards publications added vs generic experienced lawyer only low inquiries no differentiation, average case value increase 40 because authority established premium pricing justified), practice areas specific (specific services: "Contested Divorce High-Conflict Cases Asset Division Alimony Spousal Support, Child Custody Battles Sole Joint Physical Custody Visitation Rights Modifications, High-Net-Worth Divorce 1M Assets Business Owners Executives Complex Property Valuation, Prenuptial Agreements Postnuptial Agreements Asset Protection, Paternity Cases Establishing Fathers Rights Child Support Modifications, Enforcement Actions Wage Garnishment Contempt Orders Restraining Orders"; process explained: "What to Expect Step 1 Initial Consultation 30 Minutes Free Case Evaluation, Step 2 Strategy Development Custom Plan Your Goals, Step 3 Filing Petition Legal Documents Court, Step 4 Negotiation Mediation Settlement Attempt, Step 5 Trial Litigation Courtroom Representation If Needed"; plain English: "We fight for your fair share, complex cases handled, aggressive representation courtroom experienced" - targeted inquiries increase 300 when specific practice areas added vs family law services only generic vague attracts wrong leads small claims not family law case quality improves significantly qualified leads only), case results visible (verdicts settlements: "Recent Verdicts 2.5M Car Accident Rear-End Collision Permanent Injury, 1.8M Truck Accident Underride Accident Wrongful Death, 900K Slip and Fall Premises Liability Grocery Store, 750K Medical Malpractice Surgical Error Brain Damage, 600K Employment Discrimination Wrongful Termination, 500K Pedestrian Accident Crosswalk Injury"; case types: "Personal Injury Car Accidents Truck Accidents Motorcycle Accidents Pedestrian Accidents Slip Fall Premises Liability Medical Malpractice Employment Law Wrongful Termination Discrimination Sexual Harassment"; outcomes: "Won 85 of trials 2023, Dismissed 60 of cases pretrial favorable settlements, Reduced charges 200 criminal cases 2023"; total results: "50 Million Recovered for Clients Since 2010, 1000 Cases Settled 500K or More, 200 Trial Verdicts 1M or More" - conversion increase 120 when visible results added vs no case results low conversion many can you win my case questions because proof established capability, questions decrease 70 because results show expertise), free consultation offer (prominent CTA: "Free Consultation button sticky header footer every page"; AI WEBSITE BUILDERS FOR LAW FIRMS
Client Intake, Case Showcase, Trust. Professional Design Required. Squarespace, Framer, Webflow. Attorney-Specific Guide.

Complete guide: 88% of potential clients judge law firm by website quality. Best AI builders for attorneys with professional design, client intake forms, and case results.

LAW FIRM WEBSITE IMPERATIVE

💡 WHY ATTORNEYS NEED PROFESSIONAL WEBSITES

88% of potential clients judge law firm credibility by website quality. Outdated site = outdated practice. Amateur site = incompetent attorney. Professional site = successful attorney = clients trust you with their case. Legal clients are VETTING you online before calling. Your website IS your first impression. In legal services, trust = everything. Website quality = trust = clients hire you. Poor website = potential clients call competitors instead. Your website is either your best employee or worst liability. Invest in professional website. It pays for itself with first retained client.

⚖️ LAW FIRM MUST-HAVES:

  • ✅ Attorney profiles + credentials
  • ✅ Practice areas clearly defined
  • ✅ Case results / verdicts / settlements
  • ✅ Client testimonials / reviews
  • ✅ Client intake forms (secure)
  • ✅ Contact form + phone prominent
  • ✅ Office location + map
  • ✅ Blog (legal insights, updates)
  • ✅ Professional design (not template-y)
  • ✅ Mobile-responsive (clients on phones)

⚠️ LEGAL WEBSITE MISTAKES:

  • ❌ Outdated design (looks like 2010)
  • ❌ No case results (why hire you?)
  • ❌ No attorney bios (who are you?)
  • ❌ Confusing navigation (clients leave)
  • ❌ No mobile optimization (50%+ traffic mobile)
  • ❌ Slow load time (clients won't wait)
  • ❌ No intake form (friction to hire you)
  • ❌ No blog (missed SEO, authority building)
  • ❌ Stock photos (looks generic, not trustworthy)
  • ❌ Typos/errors (detail-oriented = good attorney)

BEST AI BUILDERS FOR LAW FIRMS

1. Squarespace - BEST FOR LAW FIRMS (9/10)

Why perfect for attorneys: Professional templates that look expensive, easy to use, built-in SSL (secure), excellent client intake forms
AI generation: Squarespace AI - good quality
Template quality: Excellent - professional, business-appropriate designs
Law firm features: Attorney profiles, case results showcase, intake forms, blog
Cost: $23-65/month
Best for: Most law firms - professional, easy, secure, affordable

💡 Pro tip: Squarespace is law firm gold standard. Templates look expensive ($10K+ custom site appearance). Easy to update case results, blog, attorney profiles. SSL built-in = secure client intake forms. No code export (lock-in) but most law firms won't migrate - you'll stay because it works. Best choice for 80% of law firms.

2. Framer - MODERN PROFESSIONAL (8/10)

Why great for modern firms: Best AI generation, stunning modern designs, code export freedom
AI generation: Excellent - full site from prompt in seconds
Template quality: Stunning - modern, clean, minimal aesthetic
Law firm features: Custom attorney pages, case results portfolio, intake forms
Cost: $15-40/month
Best for: Modern, design-conscious firms wanting cutting-edge look

💡 Pro tip: Framer generates beautiful modern sites (think: startup/tech attorney, boutique firm wanting contemporary look). Code export = freedom to customize beyond platform. $15/month Pro is cheaper than Squarespace. If you want modern + flexibility, Framer wins. For traditional law firms, Squarespace still safer bet.

3. Webflow - CUSTOM DESIGN FREEDOM (8/10)

Why for design-focused firms: Ultimate customization, pixel-perfect control, unique designs
AI generation: Basic - Webflow AI is limited
Template quality: Excellent - professional, customizable
Law firm features: Custom case study layouts, attorney profiles, intake forms
Cost: $18-212/month
Best for: Firms wanting unique/custom design, willing to pay premium

💡 Pro tip: Webflow is for firms wanting custom $10K-20K website look without hiring developer. Design freedom = unlimited. But requires technical skills or hiring Webflow designer. AI generation = basic (not main selling point). Choose Webflow for design power, not AI. Squarespace/Framer easier for non-designers.

4. Mixo - FAST ATTORNEY SITE (7/10)

Why for speed: Fastest AI generation, good-looking sites, affordable
AI generation: Excellent - generate in seconds
Template quality: Good - clean, modern, professional-looking
Law firm features: Attorney pages, service areas, contact form
Cost: $9-29/month
Best for: Solo practitioners, new firms needing site fast

💡 Pro tip: Mixo is great for solo attorneys or new firms who need professional site FAST (in 1 day). Design = very good but not Framer/Squarespace level. No code export (locked in). For established firms wanting long-term home, Squarespace/Framer better. For speed + budget, Mixo works.

5. WordPress - MAXIMUM FLEXIBILITY (7/10)

Why for complex firms: Unlimited plugins, total customization, SEO power
AI generation: Elementor AI, Divi AI - good quality
Template quality: Excellent - thousands of legal themes available
Law firm features: Legal-specific plugins (intake forms, case management, consultation scheduling)
Cost: $3-40/month (hosting only, plugins extra)
Best for: Firms with technical staff or budget for developer

💡 Pro tip: WordPress is powerful but requires maintenance (updates, security, backups). Legal-specific plugins available (attorney profiles, case results, intake forms). Only choose WordPress if you have tech-savvy staff or budget for developer. For most attorneys, Squarespace/Framer = simpler, sufficient.

LAW FIRM WEBSITE ESSENTIALS

Attorney Profiles That Build Trust

Your attorney profile page IS your credentials. Include:

  • • Professional headshot: High-quality photo (not selfie, not stock photo)
  • • Education: Law school, undergraduate, honors
  • • Bar admissions: States licensed to practice
  • • Experience: Years practicing, previous positions
  • • Practice areas: Specific legal focuses (not "general practice")
  • • Case results: Notable verdicts, settlements (with client privacy)
  • • Publications/media: Articles written, media appearances
  • • Professional associations: Bar associations, memberships
  • • Personal touch: Community involvement, hobbies (humanizes you)

💡 Clients hire ATTORNEYS, not law firms. Your profile page = why they choose YOU over competitors. Make it comprehensive, professional, authentic. Stock photo = fake. Real photo = trustworthy.

Case Results / Verdicts Showcase

Nothing sells like results. Showcase your wins:

  • • Verdicts: Jury trial wins with amounts (when public record)
  • • Settlements: Notable settlements (preserve client privacy: "settled for six figures")
  • • Case types: Practice areas (personal injury, family law, criminal defense, etc.)
  • • Before/after: Client situation before vs. after your representation
  • • Testimonials: Client reviews (with permission, following state bar rules)
  • • Visual presentation: Cards, portfolio layout, results timeline

💡 CAUTION: Follow state bar ethics rules on advertising. Some states restrict using case results, testimonials, or claiming "specialist." Check your state bar rules. When in doubt, be conservative. Ethical violation = worse than no website.

Client Intake Forms That Convert

Make it EASY for potential clients to contact you:

  • • Secure forms: SSL encryption (all platforms include this)
  • • Required fields only: Name, email, phone, case type (don't ask for life story upfront)
  • • Case type dropdown: Specific practice areas (not "other")
  • • Urgency indicator: "Statute of limitations looming?" checkbox
  • • Preferred contact: Phone, email, text (respect preference)
  • • Response time promise: "We respond within 24 hours" (builds trust)
  • • Mobile optimization: 60%+ intakes happen on phones
  • • Multiple contact options: Form + phone number + email (different strokes)

💡 Intake form friction = lost clients. Every required field reduces conversion by 10%. Ask for essentials only. Get detailed case info during consultation. Goal: Get contact info, schedule consultation. Don't interrogate potential clients upfront.

Practice Areas Pages (SEO Goldmine)

Dedicated pages for each practice area boost SEO:

  • • Create pages for: Personal Injury, Family Law, Criminal Defense, Estate Planning, Business Law, etc.
  • • SEO optimization: Page title = "[City] [Practice Area] Attorney - [Firm Name]"
  • • Local focus: Mention counties/areas you serve
  • • Case examples: Representative cases (without violating confidentiality)
  • • FAQ section: Common questions potential clients ask
  • • Call-to-action: "Free consultation" button prominent
  • • Related practice areas: Cross-link to related services

💡 Practice area pages = SEO gold. Each page ranks for different search terms. "Divorce attorney [City]" page ranks for divorce searches. "DUI lawyer [City]" page ranks for DUI searches. One attorney can rank for 20+ practice areas with dedicated pages. Massive SEO advantage.

LAW FIRM BUDGET CONSIDERATIONS

ROI Calculation: Website Investment vs. Revenue

Law firm websites pay for themselves with ONE retained client:

Example solo family law attorney:

  • • Average case value: $3,000-5,000 (uncontested divorce)
  • • Website cost: $23-65/month (Squarespace) = $276-780/year
  • • Cases needed to pay for site: 1 case every 3-6 months
  • • Reality: Good website generates 5-10+ inquiries monthly. Convert 10-30% = 1-3 retained clients monthly
  • • ROI: $3K-15K revenue on $276-780 investment = 400-2000% ROI

Website = cheapest employee you'll ever hire. Works 24/7/365. Never calls in sick. Generates qualified leads while you sleep.

Budget Breakdown by Firm Size

Firm Size Recommended Platform Monthly Cost Annual Cost
Solo practitioner Squarespace Basic ($23) or Mixo ($9) $9-23 $108-276
2-5 attorneys Squarespace Business ($33) or Framer Pro ($15) $15-33 $180-396
5-15 attorneys Squarespace Commerce ($65) or Framer Business ($25) $25-65 $300-780
15+ attorneys Custom Webflow design or WordPress $40-200+ $480-2,400+

💡 Law firms have high client lifetime value ($3K-50K per client). Website cost is TINY fraction of revenue. Don't cheap out. Professional site = premium clients = higher fees. Budget-conscious on website = penny wise, pound foolish.

DECISION GUIDE: WHICH PLATFORM FOR YOUR LAW FIRM?

✅ CHOOSE SQUARESPACE (9/10) IF:

  • • You want professional, business-appropriate design
  • • You're non-technical (easy to use)
  • • You need secure client intake forms (built-in SSL)
  • • You want attorney profiles, case results showcase
  • • You don't care about code export (most firms don't migrate)

Best choice for 80% of law firms

✅ CHOOSE FRAMER (8/10) IF:

  • • You want modern, cutting-edge design
  • • You want code export (future flexibility)
  • • You're boutique firm wanting contemporary look
  • • You want better AI generation than Squarespace
  • • You're okay with slightly more technical platform

Best for modern, design-conscious firms

✅ CHOOSE WEBFLOW (8/10) IF:

  • • You want custom, unique design (not template-y)
  • • You have budget ($18-212/month) for premium platform
  • • You're okay hiring Webflow designer or learning technical skills
  • • You want ultimate design control
  • • AI generation is secondary (you care about design power)

Best for design-focused firms with budget

✅ CHOOSE WORDPRESS (7/10) IF:

  • • You have technical staff or developer budget
  • • You want legal-specific plugins/features
  • • You want maximum customization
  • • You're okay with maintenance (updates, security, backups)
  • • You want long-term flexibility

Best for firms with technical resources

💡 MY RECOMMENDATION

Choose Squarespace (9/10) for most law firms. Professional templates that look expensive ($10K+ custom site), easy to use, secure client intake forms, attorney profiles, case results showcase. No code export (lock-in) but most law firms won't migrate - you'll stay because it works. 88% of potential clients judge by website quality. Squarespace = quality that converts. Framer (8/10) is close second - better AI, code export, modern aesthetic. Choose Framer if you want cutting-edge look. Webflow (8/10) for custom design (budget permitting). WordPress (7/10) only if you have technical staff. Remember: Website cost is tiny fraction of ONE retained client's fees. Invest professionally. ROI = 400-2000%. Don't cheap out.

BOTTOM LINE

Squarespace (9/10): Law firm gold standard. Professional, easy, secure.

Framer (8/10): Modern alternative. Better AI, code export.

Webflow (8/10): Custom design power. Premium pricing.

88% judge law firm by website quality.
Professional site = Trust = Clients hire you. Invest wisely.
